p.s: In this Sonnet called Sonnet 27, written by Shakespeare, the speaker wants to express his feelings towards someone he adores.
He doscribes his life, working hard day by day, and how exhausted he is.
The Personperson he adores is like an anchor for him, brightens up his life and as he says: Makes black night beauteous, and her old face new (v. 12).
The speaker wants the person, he loves, to know, that she/he is in his thoughts almost everydayevery day and everynightevery night.
Their connection is so deep, that not his mind shows him her/his shadow, but his soul does.
(comp. v. 9) The message of the Sonnet is clearly, it's the true love, deeply imbedded in the speakersspeaker's soul, that he expresses towards his soulmate.
He expresses his love by explaining their importance to his own life.
The importance in his hard workinworking life.
Expressing that even when he is too tired to keep his eyes open, he still finds time, and the will, to think about this special person.
